category.title: Commitment
questions: Demonstrates sensitivity to students' ability to attend and absorb content information.
Integrate sensitivity his/her learning objectives with those of the students in a collaborative process.
Makes self-available to students beyond official time.
Regularly comes to class on time, well-groomed, and well-prepared to complete assigned responsibilities.
Keeps accurate records of the students'performance and prompts submission of the same.

category.title: Knowledge of the Subject
questions: Demonstrates mastery of the subject matter (explain the subject matter without relying solely on the prescribed textbook).
Draws and share information on the state-of-the-art theory and practice in his/her discipline.
Integrates subject to practical circumstances and learning intents/purposes of students.
Explain the relevance of present topics to the previous lessons, and relates the subject matter relevant current issues and/or daily life activities.
Demonstrate up-to-date knowledge and/or awareness on current trends and issues of the subject.

category.title: Teaching for Independent Learning
questions: Enhances students' understanding of the subject matter and objectives.
Encourages students to be independent learners.
Provides opportunities for students to take on leadership roles.
Shares his/her experience and structures instructional activities to provide opportunities for students to learn from each other.
Provides instructional activities that encourage students to be independent learners.

category.title: Management Learning
questions: Provides opportunities for students to take on leadership roles.
Shares his/her experience and structures instructional activities to provide opportunities for students to learn from each other.
Provides instructional activities that encourage students to be independent learners.
Encourages students to be independent learners.
Enhances students' understanding of the subject matter and objectives.
